jx.jx_en_mean: (of an increasing quantity or rate) show a less marked rise; slow down
make an aircraft fly horizontally after a dive or climb

lj.lj_ly: he flattened out and made a fine three-point landing.
lj.lj_ls: 他把飞机改平后，来了一个精确的三点着陆。

entry.def: If you flatten something or if it flattens, it becomes flat or flatter.

example.ex: He carefully flattened the wrappers and put them between the leaves of his book...
example.tran: 他小心翼翼地把包装纸弄平，夹在书页里。

example.ex: The dog's ears flattened slightly as Cook spoke his name.
example.tran: 库克叫这只狗的名字时，它的耳朵就会稍稍耷拉一下。

entry.tran: 摧毁，弄倒，夷平(建筑、城镇或植物)
entry.def: To flatten something such as a building, town, or plant means to destroy it by knocking it down or crushing it.

example.ex: ...explosives capable of flattening a five-storey building.
example.tran: 能将一幢 5 层高的楼房夷为平地的炸药

example.ex: ...bombing raids flattened much of the area.
example.tran: 空袭将这个地区的大部分都夷为了平地

entry.tran: 使紧贴;使贴着(以免挡路或被看见)
entry.def: If you flatten yourself against something, you press yourself flat against it, for example to avoid getting in the way or being seen.

example.ex: He flattened himself against a brick wall as I passed.
example.tran: 他紧贴一面砖墙站着好让我通过。

entry.def: If you flatten someone, you make them fall over by hitting them violently.

example.ex: 'I've never seen a woman flatten someone like that,' said a crew member. 'She knocked him out cold.'
example.tran: “我从没见过一个女人那样把人打趴下，”一位机组人员说，“她把他完全打昏了。”

entry.tran: (在争斗、竞赛或辩论中)击败，打败，战胜
entry.def: If you flatten someone in a fight, contest, or argument, you defeat them completely.

example.ex: In the squash court his chief aim is to flatten me...
example.tran: 在壁球场上他的主要目标就是击败我。

example.ex: A large percentage of these forces had been flattened by the assault.
example.tran: 这些部队大部分都已经在这次进攻中被击溃。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 放气, 缩小, 通货紧缩, 物价低廉
stems_affixes.word_buile: deflate放气;缩小+ion表名词→n.放气, 缩小, 通货紧缩, 物价低廉
inflate膨胀+ion表名词→n.通货膨胀;胀大,夸张

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使[轮胎]瘪下去;放气, 缩小;降低重要性;紧缩通货

stems_affixes.word_buile: flat使平滑→adj.平坦的, 扁平的 v.[使]变平
flat使平滑+er反复做→不断使平滑,使别人高兴

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使通货膨胀,使物价上涨

Sentence.sentence: If such an earthquake happened today, it would be felt from the Rocky Mountains to the Atlantic Ocean and would flatten most of the cities in the Mississippi valley.

sentences.cn: 把凹凸不平的表面弄平

sentences.en: The storm flattened the flimsy wooden huts that the villagers lived in.
sentences.cn: 风暴刮平了村民们居住的脆弱的木屋。

sentences.en: Flatten the dough with a press of the hand.

means.word_mean: (把身体或身体部位)紧贴…，平贴…

sentences.en: She flattened her nose and lips against the window.
sentences.cn: 她把鼻子和嘴唇紧贴着窗户。

sentences.en: I flattened myself against the wall to let them pass.
sentences.cn: 我身体紧靠着墙让他们通过。

sentences.en: After Oxford the countryside flattens out.
sentences.cn: 过了牛津以远乡村逐渐平坦。

sentences.en: Sales have flattened out in the last few years.
sentences.cn: 过去几年销售额已逐渐停止增长。

sentences.en: She flattened out the crumpled letter on the desk.
sentences.cn: 她在写字台上把皱巴巴的信展平。
